summary: E. Howard Hunt was a CIA officer involved in various operations, including propaganda and project management, as evidenced by fitness reports and memoranda detailing his assignments, such as his time in Madrid in the mid-1960s. He is connected to investigations into potential CIA involvement in assassinations, including inquiries into the JFK assassination, as well as his own activities related to Watergate. Documents reveal scrutiny of his memoirs, "Undercover," for classified information and discussions regarding his alias birth certificate, initially issued for the Bay of Pigs operation. He was interviewed regarding his whereabouts on the day of President Kennedy's assassination, during which he denied any involvement and provided an alibi. The documents suggest a pattern of investigation into Hunt's activities, particularly concerning his potential involvement in sensitive operations and his connections to events of national significance.
